page.title: 13NW.SHERBORNE:SCHOOLS (1)
page.content: {St. Aldhelm's School}is a Church of England V.C.{co-educational secondary {school}with a catchment area of approximately 100 square miles serving Sherborne and its surrounding villages. Pupils from the outlying villages are transported into school by a fleet of buses. It was built in 1969 and is situated off the B3145 road at OS ref 639178. It has at present approx.{635 pupils on roll } between the ages of 11 and 16. This area of north Dorset retains the {eleven-plus selective system}although this may change to a comprehensive system in the near future. If this happens the plans are to enlarge the existing site at St.Aldhelm's. The girls{uniform}colours are navy blue and sky blue; the boys grey and navy blue; the tie for boys and girls is maroon with sky blue stripe.
